From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: telefon, telefón, telefòn, telèfon, and telefōn

German

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Telephon (pre-1996)

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˌteːləˈfoːn/, /ˌtɛləˈfoːn/ (traditional standard; dated in Germany)
  • IPA(key): /ˈteːləˌfoːn/ (now most common in Germany)
  • IPA(key): /ˈtɛləˌfoːn/ (regional; including western Germany)
  • Audio (Germany):(file)
  • Audio (Austria):(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Rhymes: -oːn

Noun

[edit]

Telefon n (strong, genitive Telefons, plural Telefone)

  1. telephone
    Synonym: (chiefly officialese) Fernsprecher

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Telefon [neuter, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein das Telefon die Telefone
genitive eines des Telefons der Telefone
dative einem dem Telefon den Telefonen
accusative ein das Telefon die Telefone

Luxembourgish

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

Telefon m (plural Telefonen)

  1. telephone

Related terms

[edit]

  • Telefonsbuch
  • Telefonsgespréich
